messages.text: Following up on the disco with Yury: @U07VDFEFBQU @U01AKGWGLC8 @U027201FQSV let’s see what we want to do with the next spint - perhaps increase the allocation on bugs OR do a micro-sprint focused on observbility and cleanup: open for both
messages.raw_text: Following up on the disco with Yury: <@U07VDFEFBQU> <@U01AKGWGLC8> <@U027201FQSV> let’s see what we want to do with the next spint - perhaps increase the allocation on bugs OR do a micro-sprint focused on observbility and cleanup: open for both

thread_replies.text:
This and next sprint we're focusing on persisting the add-on for Wallet (ticket), it should solve the TR issue that we've been having.

Also focusing on completing all P0 monitoring and alerting first, so that we note the issues first rather than hearing this from stakeholders/ sprig
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18F9yFI3xeN0GL6q95sKTJLvLKBsZGSNm675zfn0CTmA/edit?gid=927887069#gid=927887069

But aside from that, open for discussion on how to systematically tackling overall instability and bugs.

Personally I think it might be easier to do this in a consolidated way: dedicate a smaller sprint or a sprint to increase observability; clean up outstanding bugs etc. We could consider simple increasing the % for bugs and KTLO in the next several sprints.
@U027201FQSV wdyt? We only have 2 weeks cadence experiment for next sprint, and that can be tackled by 2 engineers. Maybe the rest can focus on improve stability?
Yes, this sounds good to me! :+1:

thread_replies.text:
@U07VDFEFBQU @U027201FQSV - the checkbox on checkout for GoC is not behind the Feature Flag, correct?

For TPT, given have our own checkout page, we had to work on the checkbox separately. This is why we will need to extract the Conversion funnel changes from the FF.

Hi @U03UMPD2NNS!

The checkbox on the payments page is under a feature flag inside our code base (not Statsig).
• https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/unified-spaces/checkout-payment/config/config.ts (`enableTermsAndConditionsCheckbox`)
is it a separate one from the FTC FF?
@U7SJ525DE could you please help if TPT uses a different component on the Payments page?

*New update* :update1: :annoucement: 

After aligning with Legal, TPT got approval to delay checkout page changes until *18th August* (reason being a different initiative in the funnel which we are launching this week, so launching FTC can impact the results).

So to confirm from TPT's side:
• Checkout changes will be implemented on the 18th of Aug
• Cancellation funnel changes will be delayed until the further notice
I'll suggest we do the same in Good chop. I'll open the conversation with Yury and Seb

Over communicating here, HF and other brands already launched checkbox on 7th July
https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04BLF3PYKD/p1752079031629539
Good morning, Yury also aligned with Thomas to follow TPT's timeline on these launches.

messages.text:
Heya @U027201FQSV @U8F7ZDAPM @U7SJ525DE

You might have seen a ping on this https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C087X11S06A/p1752221071377359 from Consumer Core but tldr; they are looking to deprecate the use of `PATCH /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}` for editting delivery information as they rollout CDPS. Is this work we already have on our roadmaps as we adopt CDPS?

If not, we ideally have to prioritize it in the next 2 sprints. Technically they asked for this to be done by end of July but IMO this is unrealistic. I have aligned on a mid Aug deadline instead but want to confirm that we can make this change for our TPT and GoC brands before then. The change itself looks pretty straightforward to me
messages.raw_text:
Heya <@U027201FQSV> <@U8F7ZDAPM> <@U7SJ525DE>

You might have seen a ping on this <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C087X11S06A/p1752221071377359|channel> from Consumer Core but tldr; they are looking to deprecate the use of `PATCH /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}` for editting delivery information as they rollout CDPS. Is this work we already have on our roadmaps as we adopt CDPS?

If not, we ideally have to prioritize it in the next 2 sprints. Technically they asked for this to be done by end of July but IMO this is unrealistic. I have aligned on a mid Aug deadline instead but want to confirm that we can make this change for our TPT and GoC brands before then. The change itself looks pretty straightforward to me

thread_replies.text: I wasn't aware of this so we do not have it in the roadmap for TPT

Yes, as Desi said we were not aware of this migration, but it looks straightforward.
@U07VDFEFBQU @U01AKGWGLC8 we might consider to include this work into the next sprint (in 2 weeks).
@U027201FQSV would you be able to create the ticket when you have time?

Thanks Alex and Beatrice! FYI here are some more https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPLAT/pages/5490737211/PATCH+subscription+for+Delivery+updates+End+of+Life#Change about the API change needed.

@U8F7ZDAPM @U03UMPD2NNS can we also try to fit this into the next sprint for TPT pls?

@UEZ4PRFKM will try but can’t guarantee yet because we got another request to also deprecate the /calculate/batch endpoint which also seems to be high prio https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1752477967084729
Ah ok thanks for the visibility - I was also under the impression when we Himash fixed for GoC it also included TPT
ok lets prioritize this one see if we can tackle the subscription call after. The code where we call “PATCH /subscription” to change delivery information isnt shared with GoC is it?
Yes GoC made the change but there still seems to be some calls coming from TPT, there might be some TPT specific components making calls still but havent dug into it yet
the batch is due to a reactivation component only used by TPT
got it thanks - but for editting delivery dates using the PATCH subscription API, is this also separate across the 2 brands?

I have created https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3035 to handle migration for GoC.

We were able to find two cases, when we call `PATCH /subscriptions/{id}` API endpoint:
1. Delivery Information change on the `/settings/plan`
2. Reactivation on the `/settings/plan/reactivate`
I guess the first place is common between GoC and TPT.
@UEZ4PRFKM were you able to buy more time for us to change the end-point? does W33/W34 work?

You can see GoCs dashboard https://prdhellofresh.grafana.net/d/dpTxA52n0VMFFg8eCFyZeTfyUuntcr0KNDU67A2Q/google-analytics-anomaly-detection?orgId=1&from=2025-09-01T07:33:06.371Z&to=2025-09-02T07:33:06.371Z&timezone=browser&var-metrics_ds=de5wlory5e8lcd&var-platform=$__all&var-country=$__all&var-event_groups=&var-event_name=Addon_FreeAddOnImpression&var-event_name=Load_Funnel_Step_Address&var-event_name=Load_Funnel_Step_Payment&var-event_name=Reactivate_Success&var-event_name=Signup_OrderConfirmation&var-event_name=Voucher_ApplyVoucherNotificationError&var-group_by=platform,%20country,%20brand,%20event_name&var-brand=GoodChop&var-anomaly_direction=both

I can actually see that there are 2 https://prdhellofresh.grafana.net/d/dpTxA52n0VMFFg8eCFyZeTfyUuntcr0KNDU67A2Q/google-analytics-anomaly-detection?orgId=1&from=2025-09-01T07:33:06.371Z&to=2025-09-02T07:33:06.371Z&timezone=browser&var-metrics_ds=de5wlory5e8lcd&var-platform=$__all&var-country=$__all&var-event_groups=&var-event_name=CheckoutAddress_ChangeFirstDeliveryDay&var-group_by=platform,%20country,%20brand,%20event_name&var-brand=The%20Pets%20Table&var-anomaly_direction=decrease also set up for TPT( but no Slack channel to send alerts) - `CheckoutAddress_ZipcodeValid` and `CheckoutAddress_ChangeFirstDeliveryDay`

Feel free to contact @U068H5475SP (who leads this initiative) to set up it for TPT.

I'm happy to give you move context too if you have any questions.

@U03UMPD2NNS I can also share more context with you Maria

messages.raw_text:
Heya team,

Just a heads up that in a leadership channel this bug <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/DPLAT-2364|ticket> was raised, and although it mentions that it only affects Factor & HF, in the discovery it was mentioned that <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04QG9G93S9/p1758228319684479?thread_ts=1758119183.297329&cid=C04QG9G93S9|more> brands are affected so I'm thinking this might be related to some of the cadence issues we have been seeing across GoodChop & TPT in the past.

<@U027201FQSV> <@U8F7ZDAPM> <@U03UMPD2NNS> <@U01AKGWGLC8> Have we gotten complaints about this flow in the past and could we take a moment to quickly confirm if this is an issue for our brands pls? :pray:

thread_replies.text:
interesting
I'll review the flows in the afternoon
I think, thanks to Endless Pause we might be safe in here. I just tested changing the address and the delivery is still expected in the same week.
Tested and no issue for Good Chop
